<div class="c6 " style="margin-bottom:7px">
<!-- <![endif]-->
<table width="100%" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" border="0" style="border-collapse: collapse;">
<tr>
<th class="card" style="text-align:left;font-weight:400;font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:16px;color:#333;display:block;background-color:#fff;border-radius:15px;border:1px solid #e6e6e6;border-collapse:collapse;box-shadow:none;margin-bottom:0px">
<table width="100%" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" border="0" style="border-collapse: collapse;">
<tr>
<td style="padding: 15px;">
<h3 style="font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:16px;color:#1c7ff2;font-weight:700;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:0">
CANNABIS
</h3>
<h1 style="font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:24px;color:#333;font-weight:700;margin-bottom:0;line-height:26px;margin-top:8px">
<a href="https://www.morningbrew.com/daily/stories/2021/02/03/cannabis-stocks-dealmaking-surge-legalization-looks-likelier?email={{profile.email}}" target="_blank" style="color:#000000!important;text-decoration:none;border-bottom:none!important;">
<font color="#000000">
Pot Is Hot
</font></a>
</h1>
</td>
</tr>
</table>
<img alt="A marijuana nugget shaped like a rocket taking off " style="display: block; width: 100%; max-width: 670px;" width="670" class="story-header-image" src="https://dlp31coh2a67q.cloudfront.net/eyJrZXkiOiJ1cGxvYWRzL21lZGl1bS9hc3NldC8zOTQ2L251Z19yb2NrZXQuanBnIiwiYnVja2V0Ijoib3Nsby1wcm9kdWN0aW9uIiwiZWRpdHMiOnsicmVzaXplIjp7IndpZHRoIjoxMDAwLCJoZWlnaHQiOm51bGx9fX0=">
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px;padding-left:10px;margin-top:5px;margin-bottom:0px;line-height:14px;">
<small><em>Francis Scialabba</em></small>
</p>
<table width="100%" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" border="0" style="border-collapse: collapse;">
<tr>
<td style="padding:15px">
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">Let's all just soak in that image for a second before moving on.</p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">Okay, ready. </p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">Yesterday, Jazz Pharmaceuticals <a href="https://www.bloomberg.com/news/articles/2021-02-03/jazz-pharmaceuticals-to-buy-gw-for-7-2-billion-in-cash-stock?sref=KkPzpZvz&utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">announced</a> a $7.2 billion acquisition of GW Pharmaceuticals, a company whose product Epidiolex (a treatment for children with severe epilepsy) was the first cannabinoid to secure FDA approval. Cannabinoid = drug derived from cannabis. </p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">The tie-up is especially notable because pharmaceutical-grade cannabis products tend to have an easier time with regulators than recreational products like the cannabis-laced stroopwafels and cotton candy you can get in states where pot is legal. </p>
<h2 style="font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:19px;font-weight:700;color:#000;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px;margin-right:0;margin-left:0">It’s one sign of broader momentum in cannabis </h2>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">Cannabis stocks have been <a href="https://www.marketwatch.com/story/cannabis-stocks-rally-after-chuck-schumer-leads-drive-for-reforms-that-will-end-federal-prohibition-11612292635?utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">on a roll</a> since President Biden’s election, and bulls have high hopes that his administration will soften the US’ harsh cannabis laws. Pot stocks surged even further this week after three Democratic senators, including Majority Leader Chuck Schumer, pledged to prioritize marijuana reform in the current Congress.</p>
<ul style="margin-top:0;padding-left:30px">
<li style="line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px"><span>The ETFMG Alternative Harvest exchange-traded fund, which tracks cannabis companies, gained almost 10% yesterday alone.</span></li>
</ul>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">Biden himself has opposed complete legalization, and that’s key because, without federal legalization, pot businesses will stay barred from accessing the federally insured banking system. </p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px"><strong style="color:#000">The Beltway scoop:</strong> Schumer has favored legalization in the past, but the cause could gain momentum now that his party holds a majority in the Senate. Owen Bennett, an analyst at financial services firm Jefferies, wrote in a note to clients that he expects legislation in the not-too-distant future that allows pot businesses to 1) use federally insured banks 2) list on US exchanges and 3) access capital markets. </p>

<table width="100%" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" border="0" style="border-collapse: collapse;">
<tr>
<td style="padding-top: 12px;">
<a href="https://www.facebook.com/sharer/sharer.php?u=https%3A%2F%2Fwww.morningbrew.com%2Fdaily%2Fstories%2F2021%2F02%2F03%2Fcannabis-stocks-dealmaking-surge-legalization-looks-likelier" target="_blank" rel="noopener" style="text-decoration: none;" class="">

<tr>
<th class="card" style="text-align:left;font-weight:400;font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:16px;color:#333;display:block;background-color:#fff;border-radius:15px;border:1px solid #e6e6e6;border-collapse:collapse;box-shadow:none;margin-bottom:0px">
<table width="100%" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" border="0" style="border-collapse: collapse;">

<td style="padding: 15px;">
<h3 style="font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:16px;color:#1c7ff2;font-weight:700;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:0">
INTERNATIONAL
</h3>
<h1 style="font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:24px;color:#333;font-weight:700;margin-bottom:0;line-height:26px;margin-top:8px">
<a href="https://www.morningbrew.com/daily/stories/2021/02/03/mario-draghi-tapped-form-italys-new-government?email={{profile.email}}" target="_blank" style="color:#000000!important;text-decoration:none;border-bottom:none!important;">
<font color="#000000">
Draghi Gets the Call
</font></a>
</h1>
</td>
</tr>
</table>
<!--[if mso]>
<img alt="Batman gif" style="display: block; width: 100%; max-width: 670px;" width="670" height=377 src="https://media.giphy.com/media/Mige4cGk6l3Gg/giphy.gif">
<![endif]-->
<!--[if !mso]>--><!-- -->
<img class="story-header-image" alt="Batman gif" style="display: block; width: 100%; max-width: 670px;" width="670" src="https://media.giphy.com/media/Mige4cGk6l3Gg/giphy.gif">
<!--<![endif]-->
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px;padding-left:10px;margin-top:5px;margin-bottom:0px;line-height:14px;">
<small><em>Giphy</em></small>
</p>
<table width="100%" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" border="0" style="border-collapse: collapse;">
<tr>
<td style="padding:15px">
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">Like Commissioner Gordon beaming the Bat-Signal into the night sky, Italy’s president is calling on his own Dark Knight, economist Mario Draghi, to <a href="https://www.nytimes.com/2021/02/03/world/europe/mario-draghi-italy-government.html?action=click&module=Latest&pgtype=Homepage&utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">save</a> the country from its deepest economic crisis since WWII.</p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">The enormous task ahead requires less repelling and Krav Maga and more relationship-building and inspired policymaking, which is great news for a guy with Draghi’s experience.</p>
<ul style="margin-top:0;padding-left:30px">
<li aria-level="1" style="line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px">
<span>As president of the</span><span><em> </em></span><span>European Central Bank during the continent's debt crisis, Draghi famously vowed in 2012 to do “whatever it takes” to save the euro. And he’s widely respected among Europe’s financial elite for doing just that.  </span>
</li>
<li aria-level="1" style="line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px"><span>The Italian stock market rose yesterday following the news that Draghi would take charge.</span></li>
</ul>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px"><strong style="color:#000">Zoom out: </strong>Italy’s economy <a href="https://www.wsj.com/articles/mario-draghi-is-asked-to-form-a-government-in-recession-hit-italy-11612354601?mod=hp_lead_pos11&utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">shrank almost 9%</a> last year because of the pandemic, but even before Covid-19, growth was disappointing and national debt was escalating.  </p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px"><strong style="color:#000">Looking ahead...</strong>if Draghi is able to corral lawmakers into forming a new government, he’ll have $240 billion in EU economic recovery funds to play with.</p>

<th class="card" style="text-align:left;font-weight:400;font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:16px;color:#333;display:block;background-color:#fff;border-radius:15px;border:1px solid #e6e6e6;border-collapse:collapse;box-shadow:none;margin-bottom:0px">

<td style="padding: 15px;">
<h3 style="font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:16px;color:#1c7ff2;font-weight:700;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:0">
TRADING
</h3>
<h1 style="font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:24px;color:#333;font-weight:700;margin-bottom:0;line-height:26px;margin-top:8px">
<a href="https://www.morningbrew.com/daily/stories/2021/02/03/institutions-professionals-also-made-money-off-gamestop?email={{profile.email}}" target="_blank" style="color:#000000!important;text-decoration:none;border-bottom:none!important;">
<font color="#000000">
The GameStop Saga Isn’t Just an Underdog Story
</font></a>
</h1>
</td>
</tr>
</table>
<img alt="GameStop under a magnifying glass" style="display: block; width: 100%; max-width: 670px;" width="670" class="story-header-image" src="https://dlp31coh2a67q.cloudfront.net/eyJrZXkiOiJ1cGxvYWRzL21lZGl1bS9hc3NldC8zODcwL2dhbWVzdG9wLmpwZyIsImJ1Y2tldCI6Im9zbG8tcHJvZHVjdGlvbiIsImVkaXRzIjp7InJlc2l6ZSI6eyJ3aWR0aCI6MTAwMCwiaGVpZ2h0IjpudWxsfX19">
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px;padding-left:10px;margin-top:5px;margin-bottom:0px;line-height:14px;">
<small><em>Francis Scialabba</em></small>
</p>
<table width="100%" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" border="0" style="border-collapse: collapse;">
<tr>
<td style="padding:15px">
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">MIT graduate student Anubhav Guha turned $500 into <a href="https://www.wsj.com/articles/for-one-gamestop-trader-the-wild-ride-was-almost-as-good-as-the-enormous-payoff-11612348200?mod=hp_lead_pos2&utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">more than $200,000</a> in less than three weeks trading options on GameStop. Other amateur traders paid off their student loans with their $GME earnings.</p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">But as the biggest finance story of 2021 continues to shake out, we’re starting to learn that many bigger, institutional players also cleaned up on the epic rally in meme stocks. </p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">While Reddit forums were murmuring about GameStop, asset manager Fidelity was snapping up <a href="https://www.ft.com/content/f8dd7dba-3ba3-4ed8-bf7f-dffadab6112d?utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">10% of the retailer's total outstanding shares</a>. Those holdings would have been worth over $2 billion at the end of January had it not sold off portions during GameStop’s rise. </p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">Private equity group Silver Lake and hedge fund Mudrick Capital also both notched $100+ million gains on AMC, another Reddit favorite. </p>
<h2 style="font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:19px;font-weight:700;color:#000;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px;margin-right:0;margin-left:0">But the real winners have been market makers</h2>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">Market makers provide the plumbing for US financial markets, carrying out trades on behalf of online brokerages like Robinhood. And the more people trade, the more money they make. More than <a href="https://www.ft.com/content/e4f9100e-7ef6-4807-89f9-4015db1750fd?utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">93 billion shares</a> changed hands last week, including a daily record 24.4 billion on Wednesday, per the FT.</p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px"><strong style="color:#000">Bottom line:</strong> Reddit traders were rewarded for their early faith in GameStop...but so were many of the pros.</p>

<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px"><strong style="color:#000">Bad IT can be a horrorshow</strong>. If you’re a small or medium-sized company, you literally can’t afford to be worrying about your IT infrastructure at all hours of the day.</p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">We’ve got a lightning bolt of an answer for your IT needs: <a href="https://learn.electric.ai/morning-brew-eero-february-2021/?utm_source=morning_brew&utm_medium=paid_affiliate&utm_campaign=eero_02042021" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">Electric</a>.</p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">Electric has helped <strong style="color:#000">over 400 small and medium-sized businesses</strong> upgrade their IT strategies. <p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">Electric wants to show you what they can do. Right now, if you’re an IT decision-maker at a US-based company with 15-250 employees, they’ll give you an<strong style="color:#000"> Eero 6 home wi-fi system</strong> for free if you <a href="https://learn.electric.ai/morning-brew-eero-february-2021/?utm_source=morning_brew&utm_medium=paid_affiliate&utm_campaign=eero_02042021" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">take a meeting with them</a>.</p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">IT doesn’t have to be scary. <a href="https://learn.electric.ai/morning-brew-eero-february-2021/?utm_source=morning_brew&utm_medium=paid_affiliate&utm_campaign=eero_02042021" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">Get a free demo (and a free wi-fi system) from Electric here</a>.</p>

<th class="card" style="text-align:left;font-weight:400;font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:16px;color:#333;display:block;background-color:#fff;border-radius:15px;border:1px solid #e6e6e6;border-collapse:collapse;box-shadow:none;margin-bottom:0px">

<td style="padding: 15px;">
<h3 style="font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:16px;color:#1c7ff2;font-weight:700;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:0">
STARTUPS
</h3>
<h1 style="font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:24px;color:#333;font-weight:700;margin-bottom:0;line-height:26px;margin-top:8px">
<a href="https://www.morningbrew.com/daily/stories/2021/02/03/fundraising-roundup?email={{profile.email}}" target="_blank" style="color:#000000!important;text-decoration:none;border-bottom:none!important;">
<font color="#000000">
Fundraising Roundup
</font></a>
</h1>
</td>
</tr>
</table>
<table width="100%" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" border="0" style="border-collapse: collapse;">
<tr>
<td style="padding-right:15px;padding-bottom:15px;padding-left:15px;padding-top:0px">
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">Startups have raised an alphabet soup of new rounds in the past few days. Here are some interesting disruptors newly flush with cash.</p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px"><strong style="color:#000">Wine recs: </strong>Vivino, a wine <a href="https://techcrunch.com/2021/02/03/vivino-raises-155-million-for-wine-recommendation-and-marketplace-app/?utm_source=feedburner&utm_medium=feed&utm_campaign=Feed%3A+Techcrunch+%28TechCrunch%29&utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">recommendation app</a> for people who don’t know a Pinot Gris from a Pinot Noir, closed a $155 million Series D. Its user base has nearly doubled in the last three years to 50 million as more people endeavor to identify wines beyond their color schemes. </p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px"><strong style="color:#000">Grocery delivery: </strong>Imagine a more organic-focused version of Instacart and you get <a href="https://techcrunch.com/2021/02/03/good-eggs-funding-2/?utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">Good Eggs</a>. It’s an e-commerce service that delivers everything from groceries to meal prep kits, all from local sources. It’s using the $100 million it recently raised to expand in Southern California.  </p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px"><strong style="color:#000">Preschool software: </strong>Former <em>Shark Tank</em> contestant Brightwheel’s latest $55 million raise values it at $600 million. Brightwheel provides software for preschools and daycares to communicate with parents, and <a href="https://www.bloomberg.com/news/articles/2021-02-03/preschool-software-firm-brightwheel-valued-at-600-million?sref=KkPzpZvz&utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">grew its business</a> last year despite most child care centers shutting their doors for a period. </p>

<table width="100%" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" border="0" style="border-collapse: collapse;">
<tr>
<th class="card" style="text-align:left;font-weight:400;font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:16px;color:#333;display:block;background-color:#fff;border-radius:15px;border:1px solid #e6e6e6;border-collapse:collapse;box-shadow:none;margin-bottom:0px">
<table width="100%" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" border="0" style="border-collapse: collapse;">
<tr>
<td style="padding: 15px;">
<h3 style="font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:16px;color:#1c7ff2;font-weight:700;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:0">
ENTERTAINMENT
</h3>
<h1 style="font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:24px;color:#333;font-weight:700;margin-bottom:0;line-height:26px;margin-top:8px">
<a href="https://www.morningbrew.com/daily/stories/2021/02/03/netflix-sweeps-2021-golden-globe-nominations?email={{profile.email}}" target="_blank" style="color:#000000!important;text-decoration:none;border-bottom:none!important;">
<font color="#000000">
2021 Golden Globes for Netflix
</font></a>
</h1>
</td>
</tr>
</table>
<!--[if mso]>
<img alt="GIF of Sacha Baron Cohen as Borat saying "Great Success" " style="display: block; width: 100%; max-width: 670px;" width="670" height=377 src="https://media.giphy.com/media/a0h7sAqON67nO/giphy.gif">
<![endif]-->
<!--[if !mso]>--><!-- -->
<img class="story-header-image" alt='GIF of Sacha Baron Cohen as Borat saying "Great Success" ' style="display: block; width: 100%; max-width: 670px;" width="670" src="https://media.giphy.com/media/a0h7sAqON67nO/giphy.gif">
<!--<![endif]-->
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px;padding-left:10px;margin-top:5px;margin-bottom:0px;line-height:14px;">
<small><em>Giphy</em></small>
</p>
<table width="100%" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" border="0" style="border-collapse: collapse;">
<tr>
<td style="padding:15px">
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">Both Sacha Baron Cohen and Netflix had a Wednesday morning for the ages—Netflix nabbed a jaw-dropping <a href="https://www.thewrap.com/netflix-dominates-golden-globes-35-of-all-nominations/?utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">42 Golden Globe nominations</a>, while SBC picked up noms for his roles in both Amazon Studios’s <em>Borat: Subsequent Moviefilm</em> and Netflix’s <em>The Trial of the Chicago 7. </em></p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">To put Netflix’s haul in a deep focus shot, 42 nominations = 35% of the total, and 3x more than any other studio or network in either the TV or film categories. </p>
<ul style="margin-top:0;padding-left:30px">
<li aria-level="1" style="line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px">
<span>David Fincher’s </span><span><em>Mank</em></span><span> and </span><span><em>The Crown</em></span><span>, both released on Netflix, earned the most nominations in either category, with six each. </span>
</li>
</ul>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px"><strong style="color:#000">Zoom out (lol):</strong> Netflix’s recognition reflects 1) its evolution in original content since the 2013 release of <em>House of Cards</em>, its first original series, and 2) a new Hollywood landscape dominated by streaming. Amazon and Hulu tied for the second-most nominations. </p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">Wondering how <em>Succession</em> got snubbed? The pandemic threw a wrench in many shows’ production schedules, so TV favorites including the Roy family and <em>The Marvelous Mrs. Maisel</em> didn’t have an eligible season. As for the <em>I May Destroy You</em> snub...we have no explanation. </p>

<h1 style="font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:24px;color:#333;font-weight:700;margin-bottom:0;line-height:26px;margin-top:8px">

<font color="#000000">
Your Pandemic Super Bowl Companion
</font></a>

</td>

<a href="https://www.morningbrew.com/superbowl-2021" style="text-decoration:none;border:none;" target="_blank" class="">

</a>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px;padding-left:10px;margin-top:5px;margin-bottom:0px;line-height:14px;">
<small><em>Francis Scialabba</em></small>
</p>
<table width="100%" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" border="0" style="border-collapse: collapse;">
<tr>
<td style="padding:15px">
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">Super Bowl parties are a fantastic tradition—you get showered with compliments on your eggplant dip, everyone gives their hot take on the halftime show, and, if we’re lucky, there’s a thrilling football game to top it all off.  </p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">This year, the pandemic pretty much sacked Super Bowl parties. Many of us will be watching the big game solo, or with our relatively small pod crews, who we love...but it’s not the same as the typical queso-soaked bash. So to make a distanced Super Bowl a bit more fun, we’ve spun up some articles and guides to help get you through Game Day feeling a bit less lonely. </p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px"><a href="https://www.morningbrew.com/superbowl-2021?utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">Check it out</a>.</p>
</td>

</th>
</tr>
</table>

<td style="padding: 15px;">
<h3 style="font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:16px;color:#1c7ff2;font-weight:700;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:0">
GAMES
</h3>
<h1 style="font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:24px;color:#333;font-weight:700;margin-bottom:0;line-height:26px;margin-top:8px">
<a href="#" target="_blank" style="color:#000000!important;text-decoration:none;border-bottom:none!important;">
<font color="#000000">
Three Headlines and a Lie
</font></a>
</h1>
</td>
</tr>
</table>
<table width="100%" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" border="0" style="border-collapse: collapse;">
<tr>
<td style="padding-right:15px;padding-bottom:15px;padding-left:15px;padding-top:0px">
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">The stock market has been a little less crazy this week...but not the news cycle. Three of these headlines are real, and one we made up. Can you spot the fake? </p>
<ol style="list-style-type: lower-alpha;">
<li style="line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px">
<span>"Nissan Altima makes a </span><span><a href="https://media.giphy.com/media/RCdF2BRdpx7BYpCRru/giphy.gif?utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">prominent appearance</a></span><span> in Volkswagen Super Bowl commercial after creative agency mixup" </span>
</li>
<li style="line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px">
<span>"Six </span><span><a href="https://www.latimes.com/california/story/2021-02-01/hollywood-sign-hollyboob-six-arrested?utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">arrested</a></span><span> after changing Hollywood sign to 'Hollyboob'"</span>
</li>
<li style="line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px">
<span>"US toddler to release </span><span><a href="https://www.theguardian.com/music/2021/feb/03/us-toddler-to-release-debut-album-recorded-in-the-womb?utm_source=nextdraft&utm_medium=email&utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">debut album</a></span><span> recorded in the womb"</span>
</li>
<li style="line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px">
<span>"Scientists have </span><span><a href="https://www.euronews.com/living/2021/02/01/scientists-have-taught-spinach-to-send-emails-and-it-could-warn-us-about-climate-change?utm_source=flipboard.com&utm_campaign=feeds_climatecrisis&utm_medium=referral&utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">taught</a></span><span> spinach to send emails and it could warn us about climate change"</span>
</li>
</ol>
</td>

collapse;\"\u003e\n\u003ctr\u003e\n\u003ctd style=\"padding:15px\"\u003e\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003eLet's all just soak in that image for a second before moving on.\u003c/p\u003e\r\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003eOkay, ready. \u003c/p\u003e\r\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003eYesterday, Jazz Pharmaceuticals \u003ca href=\"https://www.bloomberg.com/news/articles/2021-02-03/jazz-pharmaceuticals-to-buy-gw-for-7-2-billion-in-cash-stock?sref=KkPzpZvz\u0026utm_source=morning_brew\" target=\"_blank\" class=\"link\" rel=\"noopener\" style=\"border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333\"\u003eannounced\u003c/a\u003e a $7.2 billion acquisition of GW Pharmaceuticals, a company whose product Epidiolex (a treatment for children with severe epilepsy) was the first cannabinoid to secure FDA approval. Cannabinoid = drug derived from cannabis. \u003c/p\u003e\r\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003eThe tie-up is especially notable because pharmaceutical-grade cannabis products tend to have an easier time with regulators than recreational products like the cannabis-laced stroopwafels and cotton candy you can get in states where pot is legal. \u003c/p\u003e\r\n\u003ch2 style=\"font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:19px;font-weight:700;color:#000;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px;margin-right:0;margin-left:0\"\u003eIt’s one sign of broader momentum in cannabis \u003c/h2\u003e\r\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003eCannabis stocks have been \u003ca href=\"https://www.marketwatch.com/story/cannabis-stocks-rally-after-chuck-schumer-leads-drive-for-reforms-that-will-end-federal-prohibition-11612292635?utm_source=morning_brew\" target=\"_blank\" class=\"link\" rel=\"noopener\" style=\"border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333\"\u003eon a roll\u003c/a\u003e since President Biden’s election, and bulls have high hopes that his administration will soften the US’ harsh cannabis laws. Pot stocks surged even further this week after three Democratic senators, including Majority Leader Chuck Schumer, pledged to prioritize marijuana reform in the current Congress.\u003c/p\u003e\r\n\u003cul style=\"margin-top:0;padding-left:30px\"\u003e\r\n\u003cli style=\"line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px\"\u003e\u003cspan\u003eThe ETFMG Alternative Harvest exchange-traded fund, which tracks cannabis companies, gained almost 10% yesterday alone.\u003c/span\u003e\u003c/li\u003e\r\n\u003c/ul\u003e\r\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003eBiden himself has opposed complete legalization, and that’s key because, without federal legalization, pot businesses will stay barred from accessing the federally insured banking system. \u003c/p\u003e\r\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003e\u003cstrong style=\"color:#000\"\u003eThe Beltway scoop:\u003c/strong\u003e Schumer has favored legalization in the past, but the cause could gain momentum now that his party holds a majority in the Senate. Owen Bennett, an analyst at financial services firm Jefferies, wrote in a note to clients that he expects legislation in the not-too-distant future that allows pot businesses to 1) use federally insured banks 2) list on US exchanges and 3) access capital markets. \u003c/p\u003e\n\u003c!-- SOCIAL LINKS --\u003e\n\u003ctable width=\"100%\" cellpadding=\"0\" cellspacing=\"0\" border=\"0\" style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003eLike Commissioner Gordon beaming the Bat-Signal into the night sky, Italy’s president is calling on his own Dark Knight, economist Mario Draghi, to \u003ca href=\"https://www.nytimes.com/2021/02/03/world/europe/mario-draghi-italy-government.html?action=click\u0026module=Latest\u0026pgtype=Homepage\u0026utm_source=morning_brew\" target=\"_blank\" class=\"link\" rel=\"noopener\" style=\"border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333\"\u003esave\u003c/a\u003e the country from its deepest economic crisis since WWII.\u003c/p\u003e\r\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003eThe enormous task ahead requires less repelling and Krav Maga and more relationship-building and inspired policymaking, which is great news for a guy with Draghi’s experience.\u003c/p\u003e\r\n\u003cul style=\"margin-top:0;padding-left:30px\"\u003e\r\n\u003cli aria-level=\"1\" style=\"line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px\"\u003e\n\u003cspan\u003eAs president of the\u003c/span\u003e\u003cspan\u003e\u003cem\u003e \u003c/em\u003e\u003c/span\u003e\u003cspan\u003eEuropean Central Bank during the continent's debt crisis, Draghi famously vowed in 2012 to do “whatever it takes” to save the euro. And he’s widely respected among Europe’s financial elite for doing just that.  \u003c/span\u003e\n\u003c/li\u003e\r\n\u003cli aria-level=\"1\" style=\"line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px\"\u003e\u003cspan\u003eThe Italian stock market rose yesterday following the news that Draghi would take charge.\u003c/span\u003e\u003c/li\u003e\r\n\u003c/ul\u003e\r\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003e\u003cstrong style=\"color:#000\"\u003eZoom out: \u003c/strong\u003eItaly’s economy \u003ca href=\"https://www.wsj.com/articles/mario-draghi-is-asked-to-form-a-government-in-recession-hit-italy-11612354601?mod=hp_lead_pos11\u0026utm_source=morning_brew\" target=\"_blank\" class=\"link\" rel=\"noopener\" style=\"border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333\"\u003eshrank almost 9%\u003c/a\u003e last year because of the pandemic, but even before Covid-19, growth was disappointing and national debt was escalating.  \u003c/p\u003e\r\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003e\u003cstrong style=\"color:#000\"\u003eLooking \u003ca href=\"https://www.wsj.com/articles/for-one-gamestop-trader-the-wild-ride-was-almost-as-good-as-the-enormous-payoff-11612348200?mod=hp_lead_pos2\u0026utm_source=morning_brew\" options on GameStop. Other amateur traders paid off their student loans with their $GME earnings.\u003c/p\u003e\r\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003eBut as the biggest finance story of 2021 continues to shake out, we’re starting to learn that many bigger, institutional players also cleaned up on the epic rally in meme stocks. \u003c/p\u003e\r\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003eWhile Reddit forums were murmuring about GameStop, asset manager Fidelity was snapping up \u003ca href=\"https://www.ft.com/content/f8dd7dba-3ba3-4ed8-bf7f-dffadab6112d?utm_source=morning_brew\" target=\"_blank\" class=\"link\" rel=\"noopener\" style=\"border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333\"\u003e10% of the retailer's total outstanding shares\u003c/a\u003e. Those holdings would have been worth over $2 billion at the end of January had it not sold off portions during GameStop’s rise. \u003c/p\u003e\r\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003ePrivate equity group Silver Lake and hedge fund Mudrick Capital also both notched $100+ million gains on AMC, another Reddit favorite. \u003c/p\u003e\r\n\u003ch2 style=\"font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:19px;font-weight:700;color:#000;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px;margin-right:0;margin-left:0\"\u003eBut the real winners have been market makers\u003c/h2\u003e\r\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003eMarket makers provide the plumbing for US financial markets, carrying out trades on behalf of online brokerages like Robinhood. And the more people trade, the more money they make. More than \u003ca href=\"https://www.ft.com/content/e4f9100e-7ef6-4807-89f9-4015db1750fd?utm_source=morning_brew\" target=\"_blank\" class=\"link\" rel=\"noopener\" style=\"border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333\"\u003e93 billion shares\u003c/a\u003e changed hands last week, including a daily record 24.4 billion on Wednesday, per the FT.\u003c/p\u003e\r\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003eBoth Sacha Baron Cohen and Netflix had a Wednesday morning for the ages—Netflix nabbed a jaw-dropping \u003ca href=\"https://www.thewrap.com/netflix-dominates-golden-globes-35-of-all-nominations/?utm_source=morning_brew\" target=\"_blank\" class=\"link\" rel=\"noopener\" style=\"border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333\"\u003e42 Golden Globe nominations\u003c/a\u003e, while SBC picked up noms for his roles in both Amazon Studios’s \u003cem\u003eBorat: Subsequent Moviefilm\u003c/em\u003e and Netflix’s \u003cem\u003eThe Trial of the Chicago 7. \u003c/em\u003e\u003c/p\u003e\r\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003eTo put Netflix’s haul in a deep focus shot, 42 nominations = 35% of the total, and 3x more than any other studio or network in either the TV or film categories. \u003c/p\u003e\r\n\u003cul style=\"margin-top:0;padding-left:30px\"\u003e\r\n\u003cli aria-level=\"1\" style=\"line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px\"\u003e\n\u003cspan\u003eDavid Fincher’s \u003c/span\u003e\u003cspan\u003e\u003cem\u003eMank\u003c/em\u003e\u003c/span\u003e\u003cspan\u003e and \u003c/span\u003e\u003cspan\u003e\u003cem\u003eThe Crown\u003c/em\u003e\u003c/span\u003e\u003cspan\u003e, both released on Netflix, earned the most nominations in either category, with six each. \u003c/span\u003e\n\u003c/li\u003e\r\n\u003c/ul\u003e\r\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003e\u003cstrong style=\"color:#000\"\u003eZoom out (lol):\u003c/strong\u003e Netflix’s recognition reflects 1) its evolution in original content since the 2013 release of \u003cem\u003eHouse of Cards\u003c/em\u003e, its first original series, and 2) a new Hollywood landscape dominated by streaming. Amazon and Hulu tied for the second-most nominations. \u003c/p\u003e\r\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003eWondering how \u003cem\u003eSuccession\u003c/em\u003e got snubbed? The pandemic threw a wrench in many shows’ production schedules, so TV favorites including the Roy family and \u003cem\u003eThe Marvelous Mrs. Maisel\u003c/em\u003e didn’t have an eligible season. As for the \u003cem\u003eI May Destroy You\u003c/em\u003e snub...we have no explanation. \u003c/p\u003e\n\u003c!-- SOCIAL LINKS --\u003e\n\u003ctable width=\"100%\" cellpadding=\"0\" cellspacing=\"0\"
